intro: Rutidea pavettoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its root system has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Rutidea pavettoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
